channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel Pounds Area Near Beirut Amid Signs of a Widening Offensive
item.description: Israel and Hezbollah indicated that they were clashing deeper inside Lebanese territory. An escalation in the fighting could undermine efforts to reac...

item.title: Gaza War Strains Europe’s Efforts at Social Cohesion
item.description: Institutions meant to promote civility, from soccer to song, have come under severe stress from rising antisemitism and anti-immigrant politics.

item.title: Gaza War Strains Europe’s Efforts at Social Cohesion
item.description: Institutions meant to promote civility, from soccer to song, have come under severe stress from rising antisemitism and anti-immigrant politics.

item.title: Court Hears New York Times Case Against European Commission Over Vaccine Deal
item.description: The news outlet is pushing the Commission to release text messages that the E.U.’s top official and Pfizer exchanged as they negotiated a Covid-19 vac...

item.title: Putin Talks With German Chancellor, Breaking Ice With the West
item.description: The hourlong call centered on what German officials said was a push to end the war in Ukraine. It was the first in two years between Mr. Putin and Cha...

item.title: How this architectural engineering firm built sustainability into its business
item.description: Companies can build trust by showing that they take the climate crisis seriously, says CEO of PAE Christian Agulles.

item.title: From biopharma to real estate to shipping, top CEOs insist AI is worth the hype
item.description: Stop being afraid of newfangled technology, and start letting your kids use it to help them with their homework, said panelists at Fortune Global Foru...

item.title: The world has only deployed 10% of the climate technologies it needs to achieve net zero, new research by McKinsey shows
item.description: 12 challenges are particularly demanding—and 40 to 60% of the CO2 emissions of the energy system cannot be abated unless they are tackled.

item.title: Trump killing the EV tax credit would hurt Tesla but be catastrophic for Elon Musk’s competition, analysts say
item.description: Musk seems to favor pulling up the ladder that he used to climb the auto industry.

item.title: Putin Talks With German Chancellor, Breaking Ice With the West
item.description: The hourlong call centered on what German officials said was a push to end the war in Ukraine. It was the first in two years between Mr. Putin and Cha...

item.title: In Moscow, Trump’s Victory Is Welcomed, But Warily
item.description: Donald Trump’s re-election victory has dominated media coverage in Russia, where there is restrained optimism about the prospect for better relations.

item.title: Trump Targets Temporary Protected Status for Immigrants From Troubled Countries
item.description: The president-elect has vowed to end a program that allows thousands of people from troubled nations to stay in the United States.

item.title: A Whole New Ballgame
item.description: What soccer, a recent foray into coaching and years of writing this newsletter taught our columnist about the game, and himself.

item.title: Biden Cements TSMC Grant Before Trump Takes Over
item.description: The White House is racing to finish grant agreements for chip manufacturers, but some of its biggest successes might be credited to the Trump administ...

item.title: One of the most influential female CEOs in Europe leads a $49 billion company helping others adapt to climate change
item.description: Veolia is headquartered in Paris and handles waste management and de-pollution for states and companies.
